title: Closed convex function
summary: In mathematics, a function f : R n → R {\displaystyle f:\mathbb {R} ^{n}\rightarrow \mathbb {R} } is said to be closed if for each α ∈ R {\displaystyle \alpha \in \mathbb {R} } , the sublevel set { x ∈ dom f | f ( x ) ≤ α } {\displaystyle \{x\in {\mbox{dom}}f\vert f(x)\leq \alpha \}} is a closed set.
